txt: I hope we invest in greenspaces throughout the city, so we're never far from nature, even as we grow
I hope in 2050, I'll still see folks studying their Bibles in the early mornings.
Let's make our community known as the tech hub of the Southeast
I hope that the IMPACT Center will have changed STEM education in our region
BG should continue to foster a spirit of collaboration. It’s our differentiator.
I hope BG still feels like a safe place to raise a family in 2050.
I hope that BG will have its own famous identity apart from Nashville.
BG will have a comprehensive public transit system in 2050.
I hope White Squirrel’s beer will be world-famous and majorly distributed.
Maybe BG and Warren County will be unified into one Metro Agency like Louisville.
I want BG to feel welcoming to all who come here, including those who may not feel welcome now.
I imagine that BG has a chance to be known for artists, like a haven outside of Nashville for creatives and academics.
I want to see more public art, and an art museum, like Crystal Bridges.
I’d love to see a place that’s more focused on allergen-friendly and organic food and produce.
I want BG to be filled with more single/multi family housing, and not just condos as we plan for adding housing options.
We will have attracted innovative talent through an expanded computer science program at WKU
I’d like to see more farm-to-table restaurants here, especially given our agricultural strength
BG will continue welcoming people from diverse perspectives who want to contribute to our community.
I hope that Mammoth Cave and Lost River Cave will be more heavily advertised and known around the world.
I dream that the city will have free rides to all healthcare facilities for all those in need.
We will not be overly reliant on manufacturing jobs in BG.
I would like to see more opportunities for homeless/mental health needs in Bowling Green.
I dream that we will have several Korean restaurants so we don't have to drive far for mandoo and bibimbap.
I would like to see more single family homes than condos.
I would love to see a dedicated Arts & Entertainment District created in downtown Bowling Green.
I hope we value green spaces, parks and farms in appropriate locations as much as industry in 2050.
I would like to see more development on the river that would include canoeing and kayaking.
I would like to see Economic Development invest in more diversified businesses than just industrial recruitment.
Quality development with amenities like the Lovers Lane district should be more the norm than a special district.
The unique character of our neighborhoods should be preserved as much as possible.
A commuter service to Nashville airport / Broadway would be nice to have by 2050.
I would like to see more beautification along corridors to BG.
BG should be an attractive community for global talent where a variety of people want to live.
I hope the BG of 2050 provides more ESL support to our international community, so they can become more integrated into our workforce.
BG should continue to focus on parks and quality of life.
Bowling Green will have multiple effectively located food pantries open to those in need.
I would like to see diversified development on Exit 28 to enhance and beautify the area near one of our biggest draws - the National Corvette Museum.
It is my hope that Bowling Green would strengthen and enforce its signage ordinance. Abandoned interstate and other signage is a bad look for BG.
Bowling Green should address food dessert challenges and work to solve the problem with high quality options.
In 2050, BG will have a stronger student [and student family] community and support network between K-12 schools, not just within them.
I hope that people will value and use the public transit system.
I hope to see art galleries in BG by 2050.
BG should encourage a variety of housing styles.
Bowling Green needs great places to dance during the weekends, not just country music line dancing.
BG should take stronger measures to encourage the revitalization and/or restoration of dilapidated historic properties.
We need better outdoor advertising options on I-65.
BG should encourage more walking downtown versus parking lots.
We need to expand or bolster public educational resources like the public library.
BG should do more inclusive intercultural celebrations for international individuals.
BG needs a Catholic High School by 2050.
Historic properties should be preserved as best as possible.
BG needs more locals to organize festivals and special events in the heart of downtown.
I would like to see an increase in staff of BG police and WC sheriffs department to have more officers for our growing community.
BG needs more indoor attractions for families, such as educational museums that are free or low cost to the general public.
I would like to see more private education options for our children.
I would like more support for non-tech startups.
I would like to see the city address vacant buildings in downtown and have a process for taxing owners.
BG needs a children’s museum by 2050.
I would like to see BG developed as an attractive destination for international students.
I would like to see more outdoor activities for the community in BG.
Bowling Green should develop more and better mental health services options.

BG should take measures to be known as an advanced automotive manufacturing tech hub.
I would like to see better road infrastructure around and inside Bowling Green in the future, especially as traffic increases.
Cultural and art festivals (music, etc) should continue and increase in number and diversity, reflecting the community.
We will not criminalize homelessness in the future.

We should incorporate large roundabouts at our major intersections to eliminate poorly timed stoplights in the future.
We need more affordable housing options in the Bowling Green of 2050.
I feel we should build communities within housing developments that have grocery, stores, and more within walking distance--not just houses.
We need more FREE parking in the Bowling Green of the future.
We will have reliable alternative methods of travel: walking, cycling, and public transport.
We have great schools, but I would like to see all schools offering excellent education and opportunities. Public or private remains a choice.
I would like to see greenways in scenic areas for safer walking and bike riding.
I would love to see more public art.
We will have modernized healthcare facilities.
I would like to see BG's businesses & locals embrace, welcome, & accept new businesses, instead of having one major dynamo partner per industry.
We will have more healthcare options on the edge of town instead of concentrating them all downtown.
We will have more health care specialists so we don't have to depend so much on Nashville.
I hope we preserve green space as we grow!
We will embrace R&D and micro factories to encourage more innovation and entrepreneurism in the automotive sector.
In the future, our public transit will go to county parks.
We will be open to new businesses expanding into our region, as well as encouraging locally headquartered startups. (Both can be true.)
We will have a digital version of events in the future that will be as used as SOKY Happening’s physical magazine today.
We will have more pre-k options for students in the future, that are both affordable and available.
We will have invested in the jobs and infrastructure to build the right solutions to road management early so that the growth won't hit us hard.
In the future, we'll be able to compete on pay with major cities for the best talent in the country.
We will have tax exemptions and other incentives for daycare providers, or for companies to offer daycare for their employees.
We will have tax exemptions for companies who offer on-site healthcare and behavioral health.
I would like to see us increase development of the riverfront, connecting it with downtown.
We should prioritize developing the county as much as we are developing the city. County development will aide in traffic / overpopulation.
I hope we have more healthy food options and less greasy foods.
Bowling Green will increase its entertainment options, such as more concerts/sporting events.
BG will have better shopping options.
Alvaton will get a major grocery store.
We will have entertainment options for families without children.
I hope we have stricter guidelines for new buildings. More cheap-looking metal buildings in prominent locations will continue to make our city look bad.
We will find a solution to combat panhandling. It makes a bad impression on visitors to our city. And it’s annoying!
We will have other transportation options that are greener and cleaner.
We will have more intentional and comprehensive visioning and innovative land-use planning with smart growth zoning to prevent uncontrolled sprawl.
We'll have a community of local ambassadors that advocate/create unique experiences that discourage travel to Nashville and beyond.
Locals will know our city’s history/how we grew/why we’re here. It’s compelling/organic to have more immersive experiences like Unseen BG.
BG will continue collaborating with other KY cities to provide unique tourist/staycation-drive experiences showcasing our stories.
Locals in 2050 will understand that tourism, biz travel, & hospitality are important to our economy, saving locals thousands in tax dollars annually.
I hope we will continue advocating for revitalization of Downtown and utilizing its existing neighborhoods’ input/education/history on projects.
Downtown parking will mimic the WKU campus' design, encouraging more walkability/community spaces instead of dead asphalt.
We'll continue telling grassroots stories & growing from them as neighbors...even when it’s uncomfortable/unsettling, like Jonesville & Shake Rag.
Still growing out of the December 2021 tornadoes, BG and Warren County combined will have a shared disaster preparedness plan in 2050.

In 2050, BG will no longer have individuals who have issues with meeting their basic needs.
The BG of the future will not have developers purchasing lots and creating pay-to-park lots because it is detrimental to downtown growth.
I hope our transit system will no longer be difficult to understand for many residents in the BG community.
By 2050, our transit system will expand to industrial areas.
In 2050, I will be able to afford to live here.
In 2050, schools will be fully funded and not lacking in resources.
In 2050, BG will have a 5k walk / run in addition to the current BG marathon.
We will have a full-fledged local transit service in 2050, even if there is limited capacity.

We will develop Lover’s Lane to be "5th Avenue" of the town.

In 2050, BG should have a permanent indoor ice rink.
I hope more businesses embrace putting up more American flags around town in 2050.
As BG welcomes everyone, every incoming culture will work hard to blend in while preserving core southern culture.
As BG welcomes folks from all over, we will share Kentucky traditions we want to keep and continue to build a distinctive BGKY culture.
We will have a tourist welcome center at the Corvette Museum I-65 exit, where the majority of tourists are entering our city.
In 2050, BG will have an upscale amphitheater.
BG will name our neighborhoods and create maps to identify them in the future. (See nashvilleguru.com for example.)
We will have high-speed rail that connects Pikeville, to Lexington, to Louisville, to BG, to Nashville.
In the Bowling Green of the future, we will preserve our willingness to work together across entities, cultures, and generations.
We will maintain the unique identities of Smiths Grove, Oakland, Woodburn, and Plum Springs in the future.
In the future, we will allow all types of development, anywhere in the county.
In the Bowling Green of 2050, development should only be allowed where adequate infrastructure exists.
Existing roads will be improved for increased mobility through developed areas, rather than building new roads further out into the county.
New roads will be constructed in rural areas to bypass and ultimately avoid traffic congestion.
The airport will be moved, and the current site redeveloped, by 2050.
In 2050, not all parks will be sports complexes.
I hope our new developments will fill in gaps of already developed areas by 2050.
In 2050, existing roads will be improved & new roads constructed throughout the county to improve mobility that handles future growth.
By 2050, we will eliminate J Turns on Scottsville Road in Alvaton.
The Bowling Green of the future will have sidewalks and parking that connect neighborhoods to the city.
Downtown will have a new residential tower that allows more people to live in the area and support the sustainability of local businesses.
Whenever large attractions are advertised by our visitors bureau, they will be tied to a smaller adjacent business (i.e. Beech Bend + Smokey Pig).
BG attractions will continue collaborating to make the region a destination for holidays (Halloween, Christmas, etc.) with combined special tours and offers.
We will have a focus to preserve the Southern hospitality we are known for, which will be critical  in differentiating us as a travel destination.
BG will be known as a transportation destination: planes, trains & automobiles. We will capitalize on that to support other entertainment endeavors.
The Church Street area of downtown and the west end will no longer have a sewage smell that is prominent (especially after rainfall).
Scottsville Rd through the mall area will be 6 lanes-3 on each side-to help bottlenecks due to light sequencing.

We will have more international cuisine options in the future, with more authentic restaurants (Mediterranean, Greek, Italian, Middle Eastern, African, Moroccan, etc.).

We will add additional trolleys for hop on/hop off service in the future.

We will plan infrastructure to accommodate self-driving vehicles.
We will have the infrastructure to support flying/hovering vehicles.
In 2050, we'll have more infrastructure to support electric bikes.

Our arts community will thrive and attract top talent and performers to our city on a regular basis.
